meanings.definition: Make (a doubt, feeling, or belief) disappear.
meanings.sent1: She succeeded in dispelling all doubts about her abilities.
meanings.sent2: The sun rising dispelling the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent3: By dispelling his fear of spiders, he was finally able to enjoy the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a ray of sunshine, dispelling the gloom in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician waved his wand, dispelling the illusion with a flick of his wrist.

meanings.definition: Cause (a spell or other magical enchantment) to end.
meanings.sent1: The wizard cast a spell dispelling the curse from the castle.
meanings.sent2: The fairy's magic dispelling the darkness that had enveloped the forest.
meanings.sent3: The magician accidentally dispelled his own magic, causing chaos at the party.
meanings.sent4: The enchantress's song dispelled the evil spirits haunting the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: With a wave of his staff, the sorcerer dispelled the illusions surrounding them.
